intro: Sphyrospermum spruceanum, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has woody stems and glossy, elliptical leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along the branches. It is evergreen and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique appearance and seasonal blooming make it a striking addition to gardens in suitable climates.
